name: Frogger Gameplay Systems and Diegetic UI Flow
oneLiner: Built a complete Frogger-style gameplay loop in Unreal Engine 5 with a polished multi-screen flow, diegetic start/settings UI, tutorialization, and HUD feedback designed for a shippable standalone executable.
bulletpoints: Implemented the full gameplay loop: start flow, tutorial onboarding, core crossing mechanics, fail/success states, and end-of-level scoring feedback.
Built a cohesive UI/state flow across menus, tutorial overlays, HUD, and completion screens, maintaining clarity and consistency across the player experience.
Designed diegetic UI presentations (in-world start and settings interactions) to integrate interface elements into the game space without breaking immersion.

deepDive.problem: To validate end-to-end platform-generated content inside a real game, the project needed a complete and polished gameplay loop with robust state management, clear onboarding, and UI that supports player understanding without relying on external explanation.
approach: Structured the project around a clean game flow: boot/menu → tutorial onboarding → gameplay loop → fail/success → level completion summary.
Implemented tutorial overlays that introduce rules progressively using strong visual language (zones, hazard direction cues, proximity indicators).
Created diegetic UI surfaces for start/settings to keep the interface grounded in-world while maintaining usability and readability.
